result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James C Ewald

records.addlTxt:
Defendant James C Ewald in court.  Attorney Jason A Findling in court for James C Ewald.  Attorney Alexander Geocaris in court on behalf of Patrick J Anderson for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Case may resolve with a DPA agreement. Defense is awaiting a drafted DPA from the State. Parties requests a status conference to determine case posture. Court adjourns matter for a status conference/DPA hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant James C Ewald in court with attorney Jason A Findling.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  James C Ewald appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Fox Point PD Officer M. Wichman. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant James C Ewald in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant James C Ewald in custody.  Michael J. Odden appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  James C Ewald appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Swanson, Branch 11.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.    This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
